alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County; Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 04 at 1:51PM PST until January 04 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT ABOVE 5000 FEET UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph over exposed terrain with blowing snow at times. * WHERE...Elevations above 5000 feet in south central Oregon, including highway 97 near Chemult and Crescent and sections of highway 140 east of Lakeview. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels start at 4600 feet Tuesday afternoon and rise to 6000 feet Tuesday night. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Lake County; Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
